--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Mitchell Timin <zenguyuno@y...> wrote:
> --- Derek James <blue5432@y...> wrote:

> 
> I'm not currently working with NEAT, but I may in the
> future.  The idea of adaptive topology is very
> appealing to me, but the C++ implementation is not. 
> The other features of NEAT are also of great interest,
> including speciation and graphical display of
> topology.   It would be a big hurdle for me to learn
> enough C++ as well as understand the details of NEAT. 
> I have always found it difficult to read other
> people's code.
> 

Hi Mitchell, one thing you may consider is that in my NEAT C++
package, the experimental control code is closer to C than C++.  It is
true that it sometimes instantiates an object, but for the most part
it's written as stand-alone functions rather than class methods.
So if you just want to write experiments, it can be done with little C++.

ken
